text: does a cachebuster not exist now?
there’s no intent for it to go away
Can you point me in the direction to read more about the cachebuster
I feel like I’ve clicked in just about every tab looking for a way to manage the caching
okay, I did find that, but is there a way to clear cache for everyone? I have errors on mobile that arent displaying in desktop

The page clarifies it a bit but to really be clear. the extension and cachebuster do not clear cache for other users, it is for yourself, for development purposes.
HubSpot and cloudflare manage the cache.
If you are making a change and it is not updating within a reasonable time frame reach out.
okay, dang, so there isn’t a developer mode within HubSpot like what cloudflare typically uses?

There is not, generally the cache clears quickly after a change has been made. While actively developing the cachebuster tool in the extension can help.

changes may hit areas faster than others due to how the CDN works.

If you are hitting a scenario where a change is taking a very long time to clear the cache, please report it it will help us further optimize.
Also if you work in preview mode it clear quickly as well.
The developer module is how the vets do it. it has a quick key of cmd+shft+1 and it will add a cache buster string to the end of a url.
okay, yeah, I’ve been waiting for 8 hours for a button link to update.
<@UNZ3LRYQY> Can you DM me the page that you’re seeing this issue on. Initial hunch is that it’s not a caching issue but possibly how the responsiveness of the page was set up.
when we say update it may be 2-5 minutes
